verses.verse: "Isn't<WH582> a man forced to labor on earth?<WH776> Aren't<WH3117> his days like the days<WH3117> of a hired hand?<WH7916>
As a servant<WH5650> who earnestly desires<WH7602> the shadow,<WH6738> as a hireling<WH7916> who looks<WH6960> for his wages,<WH6467>
so am I made to possess<WH5157> months<WH3391> of misery,<WH7723> wearisome<WH5999> nights<WH3915> are appointed to me.<WH4487>
When I lie down,<WH7901> I say,<WH559> <WH6965> 'When shall I arise, and the night<WH6153> be gone?<WH4059>' I toss<WH7646> and turn<WH5076> until the dawning of the day.<WH5399>
My flesh<WH1320> is clothed<WH3847> with worms<WH7415> and clods<WH1487> of dust.<WH6083> My skin<WH5785> closes up,<WH7280> and breaks out afresh.<WH3988>
My days<WH3117> are swifter<WH7043> than a weaver<WH708>'s shuttle, and are spent<WH3615> without<WH657> hope.<WH8615>
Oh remember<WH2142> that my life<WH2416> is a breath.<WH7307> My eye<WH5869> shall no more<WH7725> see<WH7200> good.<WH2896>
The eye<WH5869> of him who sees<WH7789> me shall see<WH7789> me no more.<WH5869> Your eyes shall be on me, but I shall not be.
As the cloud<WH6051> is consumed<WH3615> and vanishes away,<WH3212> so he who goes down<WH3381> to Sheol<WH7585> shall come up no more.<WH5927>
He shall return<WH7725> no more to his house,<WH1004> neither shall his place<WH4725> know him any more.<WH5234>
"Therefore I will not keep<WH2820> silent.<WH6310> I will speak<WH1696> in the anguish<WH6862> of my spirit.<WH7307> I will complain<WH7878> in the bitterness<WH4751> of my soul.<WH5315>
Am I a sea,<WH3220> or a sea monster,<WH8577> that you put<WH7760> a guard over me?<WH4929>
When I say,<WH559> <WH6210> 'My bed shall comfort<WH5162> me.<WH4904> My couch shall ease<WH5375> my complaint;<WH7879>'
then you scare<WH2865> me with dreams,<WH2472> and terrify<WH1204> me through visions:<WH2384>
so that my soul<WH5315> chooses<WH977> strangling,<WH4267> death<WH4194> rather than my bones.<WH6106>
I loathe<WH3988> my life.<WH2421> I don't want to live forever.<WH5769> Leave me alone,<WH2308> for my days<WH3117> are but a breath.<WH1892>
What is man,<WH582> that you should magnify<WH1431> him,<WH7896> that you should set your mind on him,<WH3820>
that you should visit<WH6485> him every morning,<WH1242> and test<WH974> him every moment?<WH7281>
How long<WH4100> will you not look away<WH8159> from me,<WH7503> nor leave me alone until I swallow down<WH1104> my spittle?<WH7536>
If I have sinned,<WH2398> what do<WH6466> I do to you,<WH5341> you watcher of men?<WH120> Why have you set<WH7760> me as a mark<WH4645> for you,<WH4853> so that I am a burden to myself?

Why do you not pardon<WH5375> my disobedience,<WH6588> and take away<WH5674> my iniquity?<WH5771> For now shall I lie down<WH7901> in the dust.<WH6083> You will seek me diligently,<WH7836> but I shall not be."
